title: Paddock set-up & contingency plans with Dawn Dalley Dairy NZ & Olivia Ross B+LNZ

tasks.task: Develop a paddock grazing plan for winter farming.
subtasks: Identify critical source areas and waterways.
Consider grazing direction and shelter utilization.
Plan bale placement and portable trough management.
Determine access points for people, animals, and vehicles.

tasks.task: Create an adverse weather contingency plan for livestock.
subtasks: Ensure access to shelter and feed during inclement weather.
Monitor soil conditions and plan for runoff.
Prioritize stock classes and adjust feeding.
Coordinate team members for plan implementation.

tasks.task: Adjust feed budget and grazing strategy for different livestock.
subtasks: Cattle contingency measures (e.g., extra 10% feed, using drier paddocks).
Sheep and deer-specific considerations (e.g., sheltered areas, larger breaks).
Account for post-shaving needs (e.g., cover combs, reduced stress).

tasks.task: Organize and share wintering expectations with farm teams.
subtasks: Discuss the objectives and success criteria of the grazing plan.
Engage team members in developing and refining the plan.
Learn from local farming practices and share best practices.
Regularly review and update contingency plans.
